The tests/p4rt/test_p4rt_acl.py should cover the UDF match creation code, but it seems not been counted?
The tests/p4rt/test_p4rt_acl.py should cover the UDF match creation code, but it seems not been counted?

Hi @prsunny, the pytest could not cover code in ~AclTableManager and cover the `LOG_AND_RETURN_IF_ERROR(createDefaultUdfMatch())` part in VS, however, these code changes have been covered in unit tests in the PR, could you please help to manually bypass the coverage test and submit the PR?

We will work on adding unit tests coverage soon. Thanks

@Pterosaur , could you please mention the reason for PR merge bypassing coverage. We would want to track the coverage issues and work on the fix if it is an infra issue.

> @Pterosaur , could you please mention the reason for PR merge bypassing coverage. We would want to track the coverage issues and work on the fix if it is an infra issue.

Mark the reason for bypassing coverage:
The new codes should be covered by test: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/blob/master/tests/test_macsec.py
Meanwhile, according to the hint of coverage, it's impossible that the line 244 was covered but line 242 was ignored.
![MicrosoftTeams-image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18609639/168851750-c16215cd-932f-440d-b3bd-3afd8b8c6b34.png)
So, I bypass the coverage checker.

@nazariig , can you please revisit this PR to adopt to existing model? Using similar `setup/teardown` functions to initialize/deinitialize orchs? Otherwise it will be inconsistent throughout the mock-tests. Ref PR - https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/2266

@prsunny the PR has been approved and merged. Not sure if i understand the concerns here. Different implementations use different amount of initialized Orchs. As long as the compilation works fine and tests are passing, there is no need to align to something. Or if we do want to have something similar across all the tests, i would expect to have some Doc defined.

@liorghub can you test the following scenario :- 
The "admin_status" is the same for APPL_DB's PORT_TABLE and STATE_DB's PORT_TABLE for ports that are part of VLAN, portchannel and that are not part of any VLAN, portchannel.

> @liorghub can you test the following scenario :- The "admin_status" is the same for APPL_DB's PORT_TABLE and STATE_DB's PORT_TABLE for ports that are part of VLAN, portchannel and that are not part of any VLAN, portchannel.

@prgeor 
I performed the test you asked for, the results are as expected.
port not part of vlan and not part of port-channel:
```
redis-cli -n 0 hgetall "PORT_TABLE:Ethernet96"
 1) "oper_status"
 2) "up"

redis-cli -n 6 hgetall "PORT_TABLE|Ethernet96"
 3) "netdev_oper_status"
 4) "up"
```
port part of port-channel:
```
redis-cli -n 0 hgetall "PORT_TABLE:Ethernet112"
 1) "oper_status"
 2) "up"

redis-cli -n 6 hgetall "PORT_TABLE|Ethernet112"
 3) "netdev_oper_status"
 4) "up"
```
port part of vlan:
```
redis-cli -n 0 hgetall "PORT_TABLE:Ethernet92"
 1) "oper_status"
 2) "up"

redis-cli -n 6 hgetall "PORT_TABLE|Ethernet92"
 3) "netdev_oper_status"
 4) "down"
```

For port which is part of vlan, indeed there is inconsistency between databases.
Before my changes,  the inconsistency occurred for ports which are part of lag as well.
It looks like we should completely remove the ignore operation we have here:
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/blob/2ea8581da4ba6f97bebde4845a234d7c810e5515/portsyncd/linksync.cpp#L215
Once we will remove it completely (I removed it for lag members), inconsistency will be solved.
@zhenggen-xu Can you please approve?

> @prgeor @zhenggen-xu Guys, can we meet via teams and discuss? I have all the details and we can close it real fast if we will talk.

@liorghub OK

@zhenggen-xu your fix made it work, thanks!
@prgeor I retested the scenarios you mentioned and also the scenario of removing port from vlan and from lag. Everything is working as expected there is no inconsistency between databases anymore.
@zhenggen-xu  , @prgeor  - Now that all the comments were addressed, can you please approve this PR ?
@qiluo-msft could you please help to signoff?

Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

I am not sure that we should do this in swss. There could be race condition: removing a counter from swss does not mean the counter will be removed from syncd immediately. A race condition case could be like:
1. swss remove the counters from COUNTERS DB
2. at the same time, syncd is inserting a new entry to COUNTERS DB

So I would suggest to do this in syncd. You may refer to this function: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/blob/473c99067c8132f8e5b3f8f2abd672b474b42b5a/syncd/FlexCounter.cpp#L986

@stepanblyschak If the cleanup of mapping is done in OA but cleanup of RIF counters is done in syncd then we can still land into similar issue which was originally reported. Lets say - 
1>the mapping is deleted first (race condition) in OA 
2> when syncd is trying to delete the rif counters  then at first it has to first fetch oid to access rif counters table 
3> Since mapping does not exist , it will be unable to do cleanup and the stale table/entries will persist.
Do you see any functional issue if all of cleanup is moved to syncd ?
/azp run Azure.sonic-swss

@prsunny @qiluo-msft kindly remind to review and signoff

Rather than modifying all of the `Makefile.am` files, in `debian/rules`, you should be able to set `DEB_BUILD_MAINT_OPTIONS=sanitize=+address` and have it apply to everything. Debian build profiles can then also be used to conditionally enable ASAN builds.

> Rather than modifying all of the `Makefile.am` files, in `debian/rules`, you should be able to set `DEB_BUILD_MAINT_OPTIONS=sanitize=+address` and have it apply to everything. Debian build profiles can then also be used to conditionally enable ASAN builds.

Enabling ASAN in makefile gives us the flexibility to affect only applications we want.
Enabling it globally will affect unit tests as well. Unit tests have dozens of memory leaks, use after free errors, and other memory errors. They are running during the compilation time and it will break the compilation because of memory errors. Fixing memory errors in unit tests won't give and benefit and will produce hundreds of lines changes.
So I suggest going with the proposed solution.

For that purpose, it might be better to use an [ignore list](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/SanitizerSpecialCaseList.html) (GCC should work the same way, since the code is mostly copied from Clang to GCC).

> For that purpose, it might be better to use an [ignore list](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/SanitizerSpecialCaseList.html) (GCC should work the same way, since the code is mostly copied from Clang to GCC).

Looks like this (and `-fsanitize-blacklist=`) isn't supported on GCC yet, so ignore this.

@shlomibitton as we found a race issue with this PR, I suggest not to merge it unless it is fixed. 
Please update when ready to be merged from your POV.

> @shlomibitton as we found a race issue with this PR, I suggest not to merge it unless it is fixed. Please update when ready to be merged from your POV.

NJ> Will wait to see if there are new code changes to resolve the issue found before I take a look at this PR

Analyzing ERR log messages popped up by this PR:

When shutting down a port errors in the log appear like:
May 25 14:03:42.802022 r-boxer-sw01 ERR syncd#SDK: :- setQueueCounterList: Queue RID oid:0x10029000a0015 can't provide the statistic
May 25 14:03:42.802022 r-boxer-sw01 ERR syncd#SDK: :- setQueueCounterList: Queue RID oid:0x10029000b0015 can't provide the statistic
May 25 14:03:42.806701 r-boxer-sw01 ERR syncd#SDK: :- setQueueCounterList: Queue RID oid:0x10029000f0015 can't provide the statistic
 
These logs appeared before as well for any port on init flow, with this PR it happens only when shutting down a port.
This is because we apply 'zero' profile for MC queues in order to reclaim unused buffer, corresponding counters are created since we configure a new BUFFER_QUEUE entry in the DB for these queues and not all stats are supported by MC queues.
This is why we see this error.
 
From swss.rec file when shutting down a port I can see:

2022-05-25.15:23:04.606418|PORT_TABLE:Ethernet12|SET|admin_status:down|alias:etp4|index:4|lanes:12|mtu:9100|speed:25000
2022-05-25.15:23:04.617730|BUFFER_QUEUE_TABLE:Ethernet12:5-6|SET|profile:egress_lossy_zero_profile
2022-05-25.15:23:04.617849|BUFFER_QUEUE_TABLE:Ethernet12:0-2|SET|profile:egress_lossy_zero_profile
2022-05-25.15:23:04.617888|BUFFER_QUEUE_TABLE:Ethernet12:3-4|SET|profile:egress_lossless_zero_profile
**2022-05-25.15:23:04.617924|BUFFER_QUEUE_TABLE:Ethernet12:7-15|SET|profile:egress_lossy_zero_profile**
2022-05-25.15:24:20.223238|BUFFER_POOL_TABLE:ingress_lossless_pool|SET|type:ingress|xoff:0|mode:dynamic|size:4597760
2022-05-25.15:24:20.223338|BUFFER_POOL_TABLE:egress_lossy_pool|SET|type:egress|mode:dynamic|size:4597760
2022-05-25.15:24:20.223376|BUFFER_POOL_TABLE:ingress_lossy_pool|SET|type:ingress|mode:dynamic|size:4597760
 
Checking the profile name to decide if to create a counter or not is not suffice since the user can configure a new profile with 'zero' attributes and name it with a different name not containing  'zero' string.
In addition, the profile fields can't imply if this is a zero profile since the size in a profile can be zero for a normal profile as well.

For error log:
May 25 16:59:47.589503 r-boxer-sw01 ERR syncd#SDK: :- translateVidToRid: unable to get RID for VID oid:0x18000000000697
 
It is reproduced when running commands:
 
config interface shutdown Ethernet4
config buffer profile add test-profile-non-default-dynamic_th --dynamic_th 2
config interface buffer priority-group lossless add Ethernet4 5-6 test-profile-non-default-dynamic_th
config interface startup Ethernet4
 
When trying to remove :
 
2022-05-25.16:59:47.581555|BUFFER_POOL_TABLE:ingress_zero_pool|DEL
 
The error appear:
 
May 25 16:59:47.589503 r-boxer-sw01 ERR syncd#SDK: :- translateVidToRid: unable to get RID for VID oid:0x18000000000697
 
From the DB the object with this VID confirming this:
 
ASIC_STATE:SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_BUFFER_POOL:oid:0x18000000000697
 
The order of objects removal from swss.rec file, after starting up the port:
 
2022-05-25.17:07:45.411845|PORT_TABLE:Ethernet4|SET|admin_status:up|alias:etp2|index:2|lanes:4|mtu:9100|speed:25000
2022-05-25.17:07:45.418264|BUFFER_PG_TABLE:Ethernet4:0|SET|profile:ingress_lossy_profile
2022-05-25.17:07:45.418368|BUFFER_PG_TABLE:Ethernet4:3-4|SET|profile:pg_lossless_25000_5m_profile
2022-05-25.17:07:45.418405|BUFFER_PG_TABLE:Ethernet4:5-6|SET|profile:pg_lossless_25000_5m_th2_profile
2022-05-25.17:07:45.441601|BUFFER_PROFILE_TABLE:ingress_lossy_pg_zero_profile|DEL
2022-05-25.17:07:45.441707|BUFFER_PROFILE_TABLE:egress_lossy_zero_profile|DEL
2022-05-25.17:07:45.441747|BUFFER_PROFILE_TABLE:pg_lossless_25000_5m_th2_profile|SET|xon:19456|xoff:31744|size:51200|pool:ingress_lossless_pool|dynamic_th:2
2022-05-25.17:07:45.441782|BUFFER_PROFILE_TABLE:ingress_lossy_zero_profile|DEL
2022-05-25.17:07:45.441817|BUFFER_PROFILE_TABLE:ingress_lossless_zero_profile|DEL
2022-05-25.17:07:45.441852|BUFFER_PROFILE_TABLE:egress_lossless_zero_profile|DEL
2022-05-25.17:07:45.496226|BUFFER_POOL_TABLE:ingress_zero_pool|DEL
 
When a pool is created, corresponding counter is created by setting COUNTERS_BUFFER_POOL_NAME_MAP to flex counter.
When the pool is removed, the counter is removed by removing the pool OID from the map.
Guessing some racing condition is introduced here.
Anyway this issue root cause is not this change so it is not relevant.

The issue for translateVidToRid: unable to get RID for VID will be handled on a different PR.
